title: Graphical Errors and Pc Shutting Down?
body:
Hey, has anyone got this problem that I have?

I recently upgraded to an Msi R7 250 graphics card. I read some posts that dated back to 2013 that League of Legends had some compatibility issues with the R7 series. I thought everything was fine at first until I started experiencing some issues. First of all I saw some brief graphic streaks (Don't know how to describe them) that lasted about half a second, then I a white screen flashed for about a half a second again. This doesn't happen as often but then I had some instances where my computer would shut off completely during a game. My computer won't reboot instantly and I have to either wait for a few minutes or unplug and plug the power cord in repeatedly. Oddly, this doesn't happen in other games this only occurs during matches in League.

I replaced the power supply to a 550 watt since my graphics card required a minimum of 400 and the recommended was about 500 watts. I'm not sure if my graphics card is broken, since I ordered it just a few weeks ago. I installed it correctly, installed the latest drivers, reinstalled League and the driver but still no luck. Is it a problem with my hardware or the game itself?

Please let me know as soon as possible, because I want to enjoy League and not deal with my computer potentially killing itself.

Specs:
Amd FX(tm)-4300 Quad Core-Processor GHz
Windows 10 64-bit
Msi R7 250 2GD3 OC 1.8 GHz 2GB DDR3

replies.body: There is something pretty serious going on if your computer is forcing a shutdown, which occurs as a safety precauution.  I can't say for sure what's going on, but we'd like to take a closer look.  Grab our [hextech repair tool](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367) to obtain some logs, and attach it in a [support ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new).  Our tech team will be in touch and help figure this out!

Alright, I'll get right to it.
Thanks for the reply, especially since it's coming from a Riot Staff Member.
